hey everyone, apparently this went up friday but i didn't notice today -- 2021 depth charts are now available through {nflreadr} with nflreadr::load_depth_charts()! these should be updated similarly to the injury reports in nflreadr. have fun playing around with them! #nflverse https://t.co/25GSW8b5aN

matthew stafford played 168 games in detroit and only recorded one (1) game with a higher EPA/dropback than what he did last night in his debut with the los angeles rams #nflverse https://t.co/feR8W4CPAF

Today I made sure that 2021 NextGenStats data are available through #nflreadr (see https://t.co/35o9cXXeNl).
And while I was at it, I was in the mood for a simple #nflverse dataviz. Here is average time to throw and average depth of target in week 1.
Wentz and Hurts ðŸ‘€ https://t.co/z4YJ19WBpR

Going to be tweeting this after every game for as long as it takes. I am well aware that this reeks of sample size issues, and I do not care. Absolutely no reason to keep Fields on the sideline. #BearDown #nflverse https://t.co/J0o6fO7Vtb

Turnover risk vs turnover cost for Week 1 

Jared Goff was very safe but got punished the hardest

Herbert and Teddy lead in risk by a large margin

hey everyone, {nflreadr} now has updated depth charts for both week 1 and week 2 for most nfl teams for the 2021 season! you can access it with nflreadr::load_depth_charts(2021) #nflverse https://t.co/KZGq3v289d

Finally, I compared the Ravens reliance on two receivers to the rest of the league. 

1) KC and Buffalo in the top 6 teams shows relying on top 2 doesn't inherently prevent a dynamic pass O
2) The Ravens will still want a more diverse passing attack in 2021
